title: Kyle Sinckler enlists help of specialist organisation to combat emotional difficulties: 'I was always looking for that father figure'
text:
Kyle Sinckler has revealed how growing up without “a male father figure” contributed to his emotional difficulties - and how he has worked with an organisation called Saviour World to tackle his volatility on the field.

Sinckler, who scored his first Test try in England’s 40-16 win over Australia, has turned to a former player called Ollie Pryce-Tidd, whose Saviour World helped James O’Connor, one of Australia’s most troubled players.

“It’s probably nothing to do with rugby really,” Sinckler said in Oita. “My frustrations were nothing rugby-related. I was born in a single parent home....
description: Kyle Sinckler has revealed how growing up without “a male father figure” contributed to his emotional difficulties - and how he has worked with an organisation called Saviour World to tackle his volatility on the field.
